learning_outcomes.description: Appraise the main structural components of eukaryotic cells, including the nucleus and cellular organelles, and evaluate their individual contribution to cellular function.

Identify, understand and relate the molecular components of the cell nucleus and organelles to their function with a special focus on cell division and cell differentiation in a variety of cell types.
Appreciate and connect molecular interactions within and between eukaryotic cells and to the non-cellular environment.
Explain how proteins are processed and transported within the cell after synthesis in order to perform their function.
Investigate experimental approaches that are used in molecular cell biology and identify the most appropriate ones to apply these to develop a strategy to address a current problem in the field.
To comprehend the molecular mechanisms of disease and how this understanding contributes to the development of new tools for diagnosis and treatment.

assessments.due_date:
19/08/2024 - 23/08/2024

26/08/2024

The written grant application will be due in week 5 - specific date will be provided

The oral presentation of the grant pitch will be due in week 6 - specific date will be provided
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Essay/ Critique, Presentation
assessments.task_description:
Students will work collaboratively to develop a mock grant application to study or develop treatments for a particular neurological disease. The written assignment will be followed by a group PowerPoint presentation that will pitch their grant application to the funding agency. The written application and the presentation will describe the disease, the goals of the research and how they will be addressed in research methods and experiments proposed in the application. More detailed information will be provided in dedicated tutorial sessions.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge. Students should acknowledge the use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in this assessment item.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Instructions will be provided in the tutorial sessions for the submission of the written task and oral presentations
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Practical Assessment - Methods in Molecular Cell Biology Quiz
assessments.task_description:
A combination of True/False questions and multiple choice questions on the learning objectives covered in each practical will be given in the second weekÂ of each practical exercise.

Each online quiz will be worth 7.5% of the total assessment for BIOL3006.

Note that attendance in person at the practical is COMPULSORY.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted online - within 24 hours of the final practical session.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Short answer questions on the content covered in the lectures. The number of questions and point value of questions from each staff member will reflect the number of lectures given by that staff member.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
